sap.m.ResponsiveScale.!description:
Overview A {@link sap.m.Slider} element represents a scale with tickmarks and labels. The purpose of the element is to decouple the scale logic from other controls i.e. Slider / RangeSlider The most important properties of the ResponsiveScale are:
  • tickmarksBetweenLabels - Puts a label on every N-th tickmark.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.m.ResponsiveScale with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.ResponsiveScale.

sap.m.ResponsiveScale.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ResponsiveScale. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTickmarksBetweenLabels tickmarksBetweenLabels} : int (default: 0)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.m.ResponsiveScale.!helpDescription:
Overview A {@link sap.m.Slider} element represents a scale with tickmarks and labels. The purpose of the element is to decouple the scale logic from other controls i.e. Slider / RangeSlider The most important properties of the ResponsiveScale are:
  • tickmarksBetweenLabels - Puts a label on every N-th tickmark.

getTickmarksBetweenLabels.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTickmarksBetweenLabels tickmarksBetweenLabels}. Put a label on every N-th tickmark. Default value is 0.

setTickmarksBetweenLabels.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTickmarksBetweenLabels tickmarksBetweenLabels}. Put a label on every N-th tickmark. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

parameters.iTickmarksBetweenLabels: type: int, description: New value for property tickmarksBetweenLabels

handleResize.!description: Shows/hides tickmarks when some limitations are met. Implements responsiveness of the tickmarks.

parameters.oEvent: type: jQuery.Event, description: The event object passed.

removeItem.!description: Removes a item from the aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

parameters.vItem: type: int|string|sap.m.IconTab, description: The item to remove or its index or id

fireSelect.!description: Fires event {@link #event:select select} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

attachSelect.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:select select} event of this sap.m.IconTabHeader. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.IconTabHeader itself. Fires when an item is selected.
attachSelect.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.m.IconTabHeader

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.m.IconTabHeader itself
parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

getShowSelection.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.15.0 Regarding to changes of this control this property is not needed anymore.
Gets current value of property {@link #getShowSelection showSelection}. Defines whether the current selection is visualized. Default value is true.

destroyItems.!description: Destroys all the items in the aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

getBackgroundDesign.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getBackgroundDesign backgroundDesign}. Specifies the background color of the header. Depending on the theme, you can change the state of the background color to "Solid", "Translucent", or "Transparent". Default is "Solid". Default value is Solid.

setBackgroundDesign.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getBackgroundDesign backgroundDesign}. Specifies the background color of the header. Depending on the theme, you can change the state of the background color to "Solid", "Translucent", or "Transparent". Default is "Solid". When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Solid.

parameters.sBackgroundDesign: type: sap.m.BackgroundDesign, description: New value for property backgroundDesign

addItem.!description: Adds some item to the aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

parameters.oItem: type: sap.m.IconTab, description: The item to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

getItems.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

The items displayed in the IconTabHeader.

sap.m.IconTabHeader.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new IconTabHeader. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowSelection showSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSelectedKey selectedKey} : string
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMode mode} : sap.m.IconTabHeaderMode (default: Standard)
    • {@link #getShowOverflowSelectList showOverflowSelectList} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getBackgroundDesign backgroundDesign} : sap.m.BackgroundDesign (default: Solid)
    • {@link #getEnableTabReordering enableTabReordering} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTabDensityMode tabDensityMode} : sap.m.IconTabDensityMode (default: Cozy)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.m.IconTab[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

indexOfItem.!description: Checks for the provided sap.m.IconTab in the aggregation {@link #getItems items}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oItem: type: sap.m.IconTab, description: The item whose index is looked for

getMode.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMode mode}. Specifies the header mode. Note: The Inline mode works only if no icons are set. Default value is Standard.

sap.m.IconTabHeader.!description: This control displays a number of IconTabFilters and IconTabSeparators. If the available horizontal space is exceeded, a horizontal scrolling appears.

setVisible.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getVisible visible}. Specifies whether the control is rendered. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bVisible: type: boolean, description: New value for property visible

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.IconTabHeader.

setSelectedKey.!description: Sets the selected item based on key.

parameters.sKey: type: string, description: The key of the item to be selected

getShowOverflowSelectList.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowOverflowSelectList showOverflowSelectList}. Specifies if the overflow select list is displayed. The overflow select list represents a list, where all tab filters are displayed, so the user can select specific tab filter easier. Default value is false.

getVisible.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getVisible visible}. Specifies whether the control is rendered. Default value is true.

setEnableTabReordering.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableTabReordering enableTabReordering}. Specifies whether tab reordering is enabled. Relevant only for desktop devices. The {@link sap.m.IconTabSeparator sap.m.IconTabSeparator} cannot be dragged and dropped Items can be moved around {@link sap.m.IconTabSeparator sap.m.IconTabSeparator} When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bEnableTabReordering: type: boolean, description: New value for property enableTabReordering

setMode.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMode mode}. Specifies the header mode. Note: The Inline mode works only if no icons are set. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Standard.

parameters.sMode: type: sap.m.IconTabHeaderMode, description: New value for property mode

setShowOverflowSelectList.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowOverflowSelectList showOverflowSelectList}. Specifies if the overflow select list is displayed. The overflow select list represents a list, where all tab filters are displayed, so the user can select specific tab filter easier. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bShowOverflowSelectList: type: boolean, description: New value for property showOverflowSelectList

removeAllItems.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.m.IconTabHeader with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Control.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

setTabDensityMode.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTabDensityMode tabDensityMode}. Specifies the visual density mode of the tabs. The values that can be applied are Cozy, Compact and Inherit. Cozy and Compact render the control in one of these modes independent of the global density settings. The Inherit value follows the global density settings which are applied. For compatibility reasons, the default value is Cozy. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Cozy.

parameters.sTabDensityMode: type: sap.m.IconTabDensityMode, description: New value for property tabDensityMode

getSelectedKey.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectedKey selectedKey}.

Key of the selected item.

If the key has no corresponding aggregated item, no changes will apply. If duplicate keys exists the first item matching, the key is used.

sap.m.IconTabHeader.!helpDescription: This control displays a number of IconTabFilters and IconTabSeparators. If the available horizontal space is exceeded, a horizontal scrolling appears.

getTabDensityMode.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTabDensityMode tabDensityMode}. Specifies the visual density mode of the tabs. The values that can be applied are Cozy, Compact and Inherit. Cozy and Compact render the control in one of these modes independent of the global density settings. The Inherit value follows the global density settings which are applied. For compatibility reasons, the default value is Cozy. Default value is Cozy.

setShowSelection.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.15.0 Regarding to changes of this control this property is not needed anymore.
Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowSelection showSelection}. Defines whether the current selection is visualized. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bShowSelection: type: boolean, description: New value for property showSelection

detachSelect.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:select select} event of this sap.m.IconTabHeader. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

insertItem.!description: Inserts a item into the aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the item should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the item is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the item is inserted at the last position
parameters.oItem: type: sap.m.IconTab, description: The item to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

getPlaceholder.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder}. The placeholder text shown in the input area as long as the user has not entered any text value. Default value is Post something here.

setShowIcon.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowIcon showIcon}. If set to "true" (default), icons will be displayed. In case no icon is provided the standard placeholder will be displayed. if set to "false" icons are hidden When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bShowIcon: type: boolean, description: New value for property showIcon

getGrowingMaxLines.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getGrowingMaxLines growingMaxLines}. Defines the maximum number of lines that the control can grow. Value is set to 0 by default, which means an unlimited numbers of rows. Note: Minimum value to set is equal to the rows property value, maximum value is 15. Default value is 0.

setButtonTooltip.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getButtonTooltip buttonTooltip}. Sets a new tooltip for Submit button. The tooltip can either be a simple string (which in most cases will be rendered as the title attribute of this element) or an instance of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase. If a new tooltip is set, any previously set tooltip is deactivated. The default value is set language dependent. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Submit.

parameters.sButtonTooltip: type: sap.ui.core.TooltipBase, description: New value for property buttonTooltip

getRows.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getRows rows}. Defines the number of visible text lines for the control. Note: Minimum value is 2, maximum value is 15. Default value is 2.

getIconDensityAware.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIconDensityAware iconDensityAware}. Some mobile devices support higher resolution images while others do not. Therefore, you should provide image resources for all relevant densities. If the property is set to "true", one or more requests are sent to the server to try and get the perfect density version of an image. If an image of a certain density is not available, the image control falls back to the default image, which should be provided. If you do not have higher resolution images, you should set the property to "false" to avoid unnecessary round-trips. Please be aware that this property is relevant only for images and not for icons. Default value is true.

setGrowing.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getGrowing growing}. Indicates the ability of the control to automatically grow and shrink dynamically with its content. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bGrowing: type: boolean, description: New value for property growing

sap.m.FeedInput.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FeedInput. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getRows rows} : int (default: 2)
    • {@link #getShowExceededText showExceededText} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMaxLength maxLength} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getGrowing growing} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getGrowingMaxLines growingMaxLines} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder} : string (default: Post something here)
    • {@link #getValue value} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getShowIcon showIcon} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIconDensityAware iconDensityAware} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getButtonTooltip buttonTooltip} : sap.ui.core.TooltipBase (default: Submit)
    • {@link #getAriaLabelForPicture ariaLabelForPicture} : string
  • Events
    • {@link #event:post post} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

setIconDensityAware.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIconDensityAware iconDensityAware}. Some mobile devices support higher resolution images while others do not. Therefore, you should provide image resources for all relevant densities. If the property is set to "true", one or more requests are sent to the server to try and get the perfect density version of an image. If an image of a certain density is not available, the image control falls back to the default image, which should be provided. If you do not have higher resolution images, you should set the property to "false" to avoid unnecessary round-trips. Please be aware that this property is relevant only for images and not for icons. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bIconDensityAware: type: boolean, description: New value for property iconDensityAware

setRows.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getRows rows}. Defines the number of visible text lines for the control. Note: Minimum value is 2, maximum value is 15. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 2.

parameters.iRows: type: int, description: New value for property rows

firePost.!description: Fires event {@link #event:post post} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

setPlaceholder.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder}. The placeholder text shown in the input area as long as the user has not entered any text value. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Post something here.

parameters.sPlaceholder: type: string, description: New value for property placeholder

detachPost.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:post post} event of this sap.m.FeedInput. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

getAriaLabelForPicture.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getAriaLabelForPicture ariaLabelForPicture}.

Text for Picture which will be read by screenreader. If a new ariaLabelForPicture is set, any previously set ariaLabelForPicture is deactivated.

getEnabled.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnabled enabled}. Set this flag to "false" to disable both text input and post button. Default value is true.

setAriaLabelForPicture.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getAriaLabelForPicture ariaLabelForPicture}. Text for Picture which will be read by screenreader. If a new ariaLabelForPicture is set, any previously set ariaLabelForPicture is deactivated. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sAriaLabelForPicture: type: string, description: New value for property ariaLabelForPicture

sap.m.FeedInput.!description: The Feed Input allows the user to enter text for a new feed entry and then post it.

setGrowingMaxLines.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getGrowingMaxLines growingMaxLines}. Defines the maximum number of lines that the control can grow. Value is set to 0 by default, which means an unlimited numbers of rows. Note: Minimum value to set is equal to the rows property value, maximum value is 15. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

parameters.iGrowingMaxLines: type: int, description: New value for property growingMaxLines

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.FeedInput.

getButtonTooltip.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getButtonTooltip buttonTooltip}. Sets a new tooltip for Submit button. The tooltip can either be a simple string (which in most cases will be rendered as the title attribute of this element) or an instance of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase. If a new tooltip is set, any previously set tooltip is deactivated. The default value is set language dependent. Default value is Submit.

setShowExceededText.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowExceededText showExceededText}. Determines whether the characters, exceeding the maximum allowed character count, are visible in the input field. If set to false, the user is not allowed to enter more characters than what is set in the maxLength property. If set to true, the characters exceeding the maxLength value are selected on paste and the counter below the input field displays their number. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bShowExceededText: type: boolean, description: New value for property showExceededText

getShowExceededText.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowExceededText showExceededText}. Determines whether the characters, exceeding the maximum allowed character count, are visible in the input field. If set to false, the user is not allowed to enter more characters than what is set in the maxLength property. If set to true, the characters exceeding the maxLength value are selected on paste and the counter below the input field displays their number. Default value is false.

attachPost.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:post post} event of this sap.m.FeedInput. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.FeedInput itself. The Post event is triggered when the user has entered a value and pressed the post button. After firing this event, the value is reset.
attachPost.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.m.FeedInput

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.m.FeedInput itself
parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

Icon to be displayed as a graphical element within the feed input. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font.

getShowIcon.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowIcon showIcon}. If set to "true" (default), icons will be displayed. In case no icon is provided the standard placeholder will be displayed. if set to "false" icons are hidden Default value is true.

Determines the target attribute of the generated HTML anchor tags. Note: Applicable only if ConvertLinksToAnchorTags property is used with a value other than sap.m.LinkConversion.None. Options are the standard values for the target attribute of the HTML anchor tag: _self, _top, _blank, _parent, _search. sap.m.FormattedText.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FormattedText. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

parameters.sWidth: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property width

getHtmlText.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHtmlText htmlText}. Text in HTML format. The following tags are supported:
  • a
  • abbr
  • blockquote
  • br
  • cite
  • code
  • em
  • h1
  • h2
  • h3
  • h4
  • h5
  • h6
  • p
  • pre
  • strong
  • span
  • u
  • dl
  • dt
  • dl
  • ul
  • ol
  • li

class, style, and target attributes are allowed. If target is not set, links open in a new window by default.

Only safe href attributes can be used. See {@link module:sap/base/security/URLWhitelist URLWhitelist}. Note: Keep in mind that not supported HTML tags and the content nested inside them are both not rendered by the control. Default value is empty string.

attachLoadItems.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:loadItems loadItems} event of this sap.m.ComboBoxBase. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.ComboBoxBase itself. This event is fired when the end user clicks the combo box button to open the dropdown list and the data used to display items is not already loaded. Alternatively, it is fired after the user moves the cursor to the combo box text field and perform an action that requires data to be loaded. For example, pressing F4 to open the dropdown list or typing something in the text field fires the event. Note: Use this feature in performance critical scenarios only. Loading the data lazily (on demand) to defer initialization has several implications for the end user experience. For example, the busy indicator has to be shown while the items are being loaded and assistive technology software also has to announce the state changes (which may be confusing for some screen reader users). Note: Currently the sap.m.MultiComboBox does not support this event.

sap.m.ComboBoxBase.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.m.ComboBoxBase. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowSecondaryValues showSecondaryValues} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.core.Item[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:loadItems loadItems} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.ComboBoxTextField#constructor sap.m.ComboBoxTextField} can be used as well.

Indicates whether the text values of the additionalText property of a {@link sap.ui.core.ListItem} are shown. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

sap.m.SelectionDetails.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new SelectionDetails. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.m.SelectionDetailsItem[] (default)
    • {@link #getActions actions} : sap.ui.core.Item[]
    • {@link #getActionGroups actionGroups} : sap.ui.core.Item[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:beforeOpen beforeOpen} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeClose beforeClose} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:navigate navigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:actionPress actionPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

uploadState.!description: State of the item relevant to its upload process.

fileName.!description: Specifies the name of the uploaded file.

visibleRemove.!description: Shows or hides the remove button.

instantUpload.!description:
Defines whether the upload process should be triggered as soon as the file is added.
If set to false, no upload is triggered when a file is added.

enabledRemove.!description: Enables or disables the remove button.

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

downloadUrl.!description: URL where the next file is going to be download from.

maxFileNameLength.!description:
Maximum length of names of files to be uploaded.
If set to null or 0, any files can be uploaded, regardless of their names length.

showIcons.!description: Defines whether file icons should be displayed.

blocked.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

terminationEnabled.!description: Defines whether it is allowed to terminate the upload process.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

uploadEnabled.!description: Defines whether the upload action is allowed.

visibleEdit.!description: Shows or hides the edit button.

thumbnailUrl.!description: Specifies the URL where the thumbnail of the file is located. Can also be set to an SAPUI5 icon URL.

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

noDataDescription.!description: Defines custom text for the 'No data' description label.

mediaType.!description: Specifies the MIME type of the file.

maxFileSize.!description:
Size limit in megabytes for files to be uploaded.
If set to null or 0, files of any size can be uploaded.

enabledEdit.!description: Enables or disables the edit button.

url.!description:
Specifies the URL where the file is located.
If the application doesn't provide a value for this property, the icon and the file name are not clickable in {@link sap.m.upload.UploadSet}.

fileTypes.!description:
Allowed file types for files to be uploaded.
If this property is not set, any file can be uploaded.

noDataText.!description: Defines custom text for the 'No data' text label.

mediaTypes.!description:
Allowed media types for files to be uploaded.
If this property is not set, any file can be uploaded.

uploadUrl.!description: URL where the next file is going to be uploaded to.

Deprecated! Since 1.50 use {@link sap.m.GenericTile} instead
Use the CustomTile control to display application specific content in the Tile control. The tile width is 8.5em and height is 10em.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content to set

sap.m.CustomTile.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CustomTile. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Tile#constructor sap.m.Tile} can be used as well.
sap.m.CustomTile.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.50 use {@link sap.m.GenericTile} instead
Use the CustomTile control to display application specific content in the Tile control. The tile width is 8.5em and height is 10em.

getContent.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

Defines the content of the CustomTile.

destroyContent.!description: Destroys the content in the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

setInfoState.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getInfoState infoState}. Defines the state of the information text, e.g. Error, Warning, Success. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is None.

parameters.sInfoState: type: sap.ui.core.ValueState, description: New value for property infoState

getWrapping.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getWrapping wrapping}. Defines the wrapping behavior of title and description texts. Note: In the desktop mode, initial rendering of the control contains 300 characters along with a button to expand and collapse the text whereas in the phone mode, the character limit is set to 100 characters. Default value is false.

setTitleTextDirection.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTitleTextDirection titleTextDirection}. Defines the title text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Inherit.

parameters.sTitleTextDirection: type: sap.ui.core.TextDirection, description: New value for property titleTextDirection

getInfoTextDirection.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getInfoTextDirection infoTextDirection}. Defines the info directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM. Default value is Inherit.

setIconInset.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIconInset iconInset}. Defines the indentation of the icon. If set to false, the icon will not be shown as embedded. Instead it will take the full height of the list item. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bIconInset: type: boolean, description: New value for property iconInset

setDescription.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDescription description}. Defines the additional information for the title. Note: This is only visible when the title property is not empty. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sDescription: type: string, description: New value for property description

getDescription.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDescription description}. Defines the additional information for the title. Note: This is only visible when the title property is not empty.

getIconDensityAware.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIconDensityAware iconDensityAware}. By default, one or more requests are sent to get the density perfect version of the icon if the given version of the icon doesn't exist on the server. Note: If bandwidth is a key factor for the application, set this value to false. Default value is true.

sap.m.StandardListItem.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new StandardListItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getDescription description} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getIconInset iconInset} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIconDensityAware iconDensityAware} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getActiveIcon activeIcon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getInfo info} : string
    • {@link #getInfoState infoState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getAdaptTitleSize adaptTitleSize} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getTitleTextDirection titleTextDirection} : sap.ui.core.TextDirection (default: Inherit)
    • {@link #getInfoTextDirection infoTextDirection} : sap.ui.core.TextDirection (default: Inherit)
    • {@link #getWrapping wrapping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getInfoStateInverted infoStateInverted} : boolean (default: false)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.ListItemBase#constructor sap.m.ListItemBase} can be used as well.

getTitle.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getTitle title}.

Defines the title of the list item.

setIconDensityAware.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIconDensityAware iconDensityAware}. By default, one or more requests are sent to get the density perfect version of the icon if the given version of the icon doesn't exist on the server. Note: If bandwidth is a key factor for the application, set this value to false. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bIconDensityAware: type: boolean, description: New value for property iconDensityAware

setActiveIcon.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getActiveIcon activeIcon}. Defines the icon that is shown while the list item is pressed. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sActiveIcon: type: sap.ui.core.URI, description: New value for property activeIcon

setWrapping.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWrapping wrapping}. Defines the wrapping behavior of title and description texts. Note: In the desktop mode, initial rendering of the control contains 300 characters along with a button to expand and collapse the text whereas in the phone mode, the character limit is set to 100 characters. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bWrapping: type: boolean, description: New value for property wrapping

getActiveIcon.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getActiveIcon activeIcon}.

Defines the icon that is shown while the list item is pressed.

setInfoTextDirection.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getInfoTextDirection infoTextDirection}. Defines the info directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Inherit.

parameters.sInfoTextDirection: type: sap.ui.core.TextDirection, description: New value for property infoTextDirection

getInfoState.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getInfoState infoState}. Defines the state of the information text, e.g. Error, Warning, Success. Default value is None.

Defines an additional information text.

setTitle.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTitle title}. Defines the title of the list item. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sTitle: type: string, description: New value for property title

Gets current value of property {@link #getIcon icon}.

Defines the list item icon.

setInfoStateInverted.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getInfoStateInverted infoStateInverted}. Determines the inverted rendering behavior of the info text and the info state. The color defined by the infoState property is rendered as the background color for the info text, if this property is set to true. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bInfoStateInverted: type: boolean, description: New value for property infoStateInverted

getInfoStateInverted.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getInfoStateInverted infoStateInverted}. Determines the inverted rendering behavior of the info text and the info state. The color defined by the infoState property is rendered as the background color for the info text, if this property is set to true. Default value is false.

getAdaptTitleSize.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getAdaptTitleSize adaptTitleSize}. By default, the title size adapts to the available space and gets bigger if the description is empty. If you have list items with and without descriptions, this results in titles with different sizes. In this case, it can be better to switch the size adaption off by setting this property to false. Default value is true.

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

destroyPages.!description: Destroys all the pages in the aggregation {@link #getPages pages}.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.QuickViewBase.

navigateBack.!description: Navigates to the previous page if there is such.

unbindPages.!description: Unbinds aggregation {@link #getPages pages} from model data.

removePage.!description: Removes a page from the aggregation {@link #getPages pages}.

parameters.vPage: type: int|string|sap.m.QuickViewPage, description: The page to remove or its index or id

removeAllPages.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getPages pages}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

attachAfterNavigate.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:afterNavigate afterNavigate} event of this sap.m.QuickViewBase. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.QuickViewBase itself. The event is fired when navigation between two pages has completed. In case of animated transitions this event is fired with some delay after the "navigate" event.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

sap.m.QuickViewBase.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new QuickViewBase. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getPages pages} : sap.m.QuickViewPage[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:navigate navigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterNavigate afterNavigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

bindPages.!description: Binds aggregation {@link #getPages pages} to model data. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#bindAggregation ManagedObject.bindAggregation} for a detailed description of the possible properties of oBindingInfo.

parameters.oBindingInfo: type: object, description: The binding information

fireAfterNavigate.!description: Fires event {@link #event:afterNavigate afterNavigate} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

indexOfPage.!description: Checks for the provided sap.m.QuickViewPage in the aggregation {@link #getPages pages}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oPage: type: sap.m.QuickViewPage, description: The page whose index is looked for

sap.m.QuickViewBase.!helpDescription: QuickViewBase class provides base functionality for QuickView and QuickViewCard. Do not use it directly.

addPage.!description: Adds some page to the aggregation {@link #getPages pages}.

parameters.oPage: type: sap.m.QuickViewPage, description: The page to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

attachNavigate.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:navigate navigate} event of this sap.m.QuickViewBase. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.QuickViewBase itself. The event is fired when navigation between two pages has been triggered. The transition (if any) to the new page has not started yet. This event can be aborted by the application with preventDefault(), which means that there will be no navigation.
attachNavigate.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.m.QuickViewBase

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.m.QuickViewBase itself
parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

getPages.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getPages pages}.

Displays a page header, object icon or image, object name with short description, and object information divided in groups

insertPage.!description: Inserts a page into the aggregation {@link #getPages pages}.

parameters.oPage: type: sap.m.QuickViewPage, description: The page to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the page should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the page is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the page is inserted at the last position

detachNavigate.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:navigate navigate} event of this sap.m.QuickViewBase. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

sap.m.semantic.FilterAction.!description: A FilterAction is a {@link sap.m.Button} control enhanced with styling according to the semantics of a common "Filter" action. A FilterAction cannot be used independently but only as aggregation content of a {@link sap.m.semantic.SemanticPage}. Your app should listen to the press event of {@link sap.m.semantic.FilterAction} in order to trigger the display of the filtering options. If your filtering options are a simple list of items and require single choice only, then you can consider using a {@link sap.m.semantic.FilterSelect} instead.

sap.m.routing.RouteMatchedHandler.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.28 use {@link sap.m.routing.Router} or {@link sap.m.routing.Targets} instead. The functionality of the routematched handler is built in into these two classes, there is no need to create this anymore.
This class will attach to the Events of a provided router and add the views created by it to a {@link sap.m.SplitContainer} or a {@link sap.m.NavContainer} Control, if this is the target control of the route.
If the targetControl is no {@link sap.m.SplitContainer} or a {@link sap.m.NavContainer}, It will only close the dialogs, according to the property value.

When a navigation is triggered, this class will try to determine the transition of the pages based on the history.
Eg: if a user presses browser back, it will show a backwards animation.

The navigation on the container takes place in the RoutePatternMatched event of the Router. If you register on the RouteMatched event of the Router, the visual navigation did not take place yet.

Since it is hard to detect if a user has pressed browser back, this transitions will not be reliable, for example if someone bookmarked a detail page, and wants to navigate to a masterPage.
If you want this case to always show a backwards transition, you should specify a "viewLevel" property on your Route.
The viewLevel has to be an integer. The Master should have a lower number than the detail.
These levels should represent the user process of your application and they do not have to match the container structure of your Routes.
If the user navigates between views with the same viewLevel, the history is asked for the direction.

You can specify a property "transition" in a route to define which transition will be applied when navigating. If it is not defined, the nav container will take its default transition.
You can also specify "transitionParameters" on a Route, to give the transition parameters.

preservePageInSplitContainer is deprecated since 1.28 since Targets make this parameter obsolete. If you want to preserve the current view when navigating, but you want to navigate to it when nothing is displayed in the navContainer, you can set preservePageInSplitContainer = true
When the route that has this flag directly matches the pattern, the view will still be switched by the splitContainer.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.m.routing.RouteMatchedHandler with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.Object.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

parameters.bCloseDialogs: type: boolean, description: close dialogs if true

getCloseDialogs.!description: Gets if a navigation should close dialogs

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.routing.RouteMatchedHandler.

Eg: if a user presses browser back, it will show a backwards animation.

The navigation on the container takes place in the RoutePatternMatched event of the Router. If you register on the RouteMatched event of the Router, the visual navigation did not take place yet.

Since it is hard to detect if a user has pressed browser back, this transitions will not be reliable, for example if someone bookmarked a detail page, and wants to navigate to a masterPage.
If you want this case to always show a backwards transition, you should specify a "viewLevel" property on your Route.
The viewLevel has to be an integer. The Master should have a lower number than the detail.
These levels should represent the user process of your application and they do not have to match the container structure of your Routes.
If the user navigates between views with the same viewLevel, the history is asked for the direction.

sap.m.Popover.!description:
Displays additional information for an object in a compact way.

Overview

The popover displays additional information for an object in a compact way and without leaving the page. The popover can contain various UI elements such as fields, tables, images, and charts. It can also include actions in the footer.

Structure

The popover has three main areas:
  • Header (optional) - with a back button and a title
  • Content - holds all the controls
  • Footer (optional) - with additional action buttons

Guidelines

  • Do not overlap popovers.
  • You can determine the {@link sap.m.PlacementType placement} of the popover relative to the control that opens it.
  • Ensure that the content has a basic design and shows only the most important information.

Usage

When to use:

  • You need to define your own structure of controls within the popover.

When not to use:

  • The {@link sap.m.QuickView QuickView} is more appropriate for your use case.

Responsive Behavior

The popover is closed when the user clicks or taps outside the popover or selects an action within the popover. You can prevent this with the modal property. The popover can be resized when the resizable property is enabled. When using the sap.m.Popover in Sap Quartz theme, the breakpoints and layout paddings could be determined by the container's width. To enable this concept and add responsive paddings to an element of the Popover control, you may add the following classes depending on your use case: sapUiResponsivePadding--header, sapUiResponsivePadding--subHeader, sapUiResponsivePadding--content, sapUiResponsivePadding--footer.
  • {@link sap.m.Popover} is not responsive on mobile devices - it will always be rendered as a popover and you have to take care of its size and position.
  • {@link sap.m.ResponsivePopover} is adaptive and responsive. It renders as a dialog with a close button in the header on phones, and as a popover on tablets.

getContentMinWidth.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getContentMinWidth contentMinWidth}. Sets the minimum width of the content area inside popover. Default value is empty string.

getModal.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getModal modal}. If the popover will not be closed when tapping outside the popover. It also blocks any interaction with the background. The default value is false. Default value is false.

parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

parameters.bModal: type: boolean, description: New value for property modal.
parameters.sModalCSSClass: type: string, description: A CSS class (or space-separated list of classes) that should be added to the block layer.

parameters.bIncludeMargin: type: boolean, description: Determines if the margins should be included in the calculated outerHeight. Default value is false. * @returns {number} The outer height of the element

parameters.oFooter: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The footer to set

parameters.sPlacement: type: sap.m.PlacementType, description: The position of the Popover

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.Popover itself. This event will be fired after the popover is opened.
attachAfterOpen.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.m.Popover

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.m.Popover itself

getContentWidth.!description:

Set the width of the content area inside Popover. When controls which adapt their size to the parent control are added directly into Popover, for example sap.m.Page control, a size needs to be specified to the content area of the Popover. Otherwise, Popover control isn't able to display the content in the right way. However, when scrollable control (sap.m.ScrollContainer, sap.m.Page) is in the popover, this property needs to be set to false to disable the scrolling in popover in order to make the scrolling in the child control work properly. Popover detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, or sap.m.ScrollContainer as direct child added to Popover. If there is, Popover will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false automatically ignoring the existing value of this property. Default value is true.

getPlacement.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getPlacement placement}. This is the information about on which side will the popover be placed at. Possible values are sap.m.PlacementType.Left, sap.m.PlacementType.Right, sap.m.PlacementType.Top, sap.m.PlacementType.Bottom, sap.m.PlacementType.Horizontal, sap.m.PlacementType.HorizontalPreferredLeft, sap.m.PlacementType.HorizontalPreferredRight, sap.m.PlacementType.Vertical, sap.m.PlacementType.VerticalPreferredTop, sap.m.PlacementType.VerticalPreferredBottom, sap.m.PlacementType.Auto. The default value is sap.m.PlacementType.Right. Setting this property while popover is open won't cause any rerendering of the popover, but it will take effect when it's opened again. Default value is Right.

setFollowOf.!description:
The followOf feature closes the Popover when the position of the control that opened the Popover changes by at least 32 pixels (on desktop browsers). This may lead to unwanted closing of the Popover.

sap.m.Popover.!helpDescription:
Displays additional information for an object in a compact way.

Overview

The popover displays additional information for an object in a compact way and without leaving the page. The popover can contain various UI elements such as fields, tables, images, and charts. It can also include actions in the footer.

Structure

The popover has three main areas:
  • Header (optional) - with a back button and a title
  • Content - holds all the controls
  • Footer (optional) - with additional action buttons

Guidelines

  • Do not overlap popovers.
  • You can determine the {@link sap.m.PlacementType placement} of the popover relative to the control that opens it.
  • Ensure that the content has a basic design and shows only the most important information.

Usage

When to use:

  • You need to define your own structure of controls within the popover.

When not to use:

  • The {@link sap.m.QuickView QuickView} is more appropriate for your use case.

Responsive Behavior

The popover is closed when the user clicks or taps outside the popover or selects an action within the popover. You can prevent this with the modal property. The popover can be resized when the resizable property is enabled. When using the sap.m.Popover in Sap Quartz theme, the breakpoints and layout paddings could be determined by the container's width. To enable this concept and add responsive paddings to an element of the Popover control, you may add the following classes depending on your use case: sapUiResponsivePadding--header, sapUiResponsivePadding--subHeader, sapUiResponsivePadding--content, sapUiResponsivePadding--footer.
  • {@link sap.m.Popover} is not responsive on mobile devices - it will always be rendered as a popover and you have to take care of its size and position.
  • {@link sap.m.ResponsivePopover} is adaptive and responsive. It renders as a dialog with a close button in the header on phones, and as a popover on tablets.

However, when scrollable control (sap.m.ScrollContainer, sap.m.Page) is in the popover, this property needs to be set to false to disable the scrolling in popover in order to make the scrolling in the child control work properly. Popover detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, or sap.m.ScrollContainer as direct child added to Popover. If there is, Popover will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false automatically ignoring the existing value of this property. Default value is true.

sap.m.Popover.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Popover. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getPlacement placement} : sap.m.PlacementType (default: Right)
    • {@link #getShowHeader showHeader} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getModal modal} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getOffsetX offsetX} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getOffsetY offsetY} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getShowArrow showArrow} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getContentWidth contentWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getContentMinWidth contentMinWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: )
    • {@link #getContentHeight contentHeight} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getEnableScrolling enableScrolling} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getVerticalScrolling verticalScrolling} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHorizontalScrolling horizontalScrolling} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getBounce bounce} : boolean
    • {@link #getResizable resizable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAriaModal ariaModal} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getTitleAlignment titleAlignment} : sap.m.TitleAlignment (default: Auto)
    • {@link #getAriaRoleApplication ariaRoleApplication} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
    • {@link #getCustomHeader customHeader} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getSubHeader subHeader} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getFooter footer} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getBeginButton beginButton} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getEndButton endButton} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Associations
    • {@link #getLeftButton leftButton} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Button)
    • {@link #getRightButton rightButton} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Button)
    • {@link #getInitialFocus initialFocus} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:afterOpen afterOpen} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterClose afterClose} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeOpen beforeOpen} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeClose beforeClose} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

Default value is Auto.

setValueStateText.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getValueStateText valueStateText}. Defines the text that appears in the value state message pop-up. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sValueStateText: type: string, description: New value for property valueStateText

getMin.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getMin min}.

Sets the minimum possible value of the defined range.

getAriaDescribedBy.!description: Returns array of IDs of the elements which are the current targets of the association {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy}.

setStep.!description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getStep step}. Increases/decreases the value of the input.
    Note:
  • The value of the step property should not contain more digits after the decimal point than what is set to the displayValuePrecision property, as it may lead to an increase/decrease that is not visible for the user. For example, if the value is set to 1.22 and the displayValuePrecision is set to one digit after the decimal, the user will see 1.2. In this case, if the value of the step property is set to 1.005 and the user selects increase, the resulting value will increase to 1.2261 but the displayed value will remain as 1.2 as it will be rounded to the first digit after the decimal point.
  • Depending on what is set for the value and the displayValuePrecision properties, it is possible the displayed value to be rounded to a higher number, for example to 3.0 when the actual value is 2.99.
When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 1.

parameters.fStep: type: float, description: New value for property step

sap.m.StepInput.!description:
Allows the user to change the input values with predefined increments (steps).

Overview

The StepInput consists of an input field and buttons with icons to increase/decrease the value. The user can change the value of the control by pressing the increase/decrease buttons, by typing a number directly, by using the keyboard up/down and page up/down, or by using the mouse scroll wheel. Decimal values are supported.

Usage

The default step is 1 but the app developer can set a different one. On desktop, the control supports a larger step, when using the keyboard page up/down keys. You can set a multiple of the step with the use of the largerStep property. The default value is 2 (two times the set step). For example, when using the keyboard page up/down keys the value increases/decreases with a double of the default step. If the set step is 2, the larger step is also 2 and the current value is 1, using the page up key will increase the value to 5 (1 + 2*2). App developers can set a maximum and minimum value for the StepInput. The increase/decrease button and the up/down keyboard navigation become disabled when the value reaches the max/min or a new value is entered from the input which is greater/less than the max/min. When to use
  • To adjust amounts, quantities, or other values quickly.
  • To adjust values for a specific step.
When not to use
  • To enter a static number (for example, postal code, phone number, or ID). In this case, use the regular {@link sap.m.Input} instead.
  • To display a value that rarely needs to be adjusted and does not pertain to a particular step. In this case, use the regular {@link sap.m.Input} instead.
  • To enter dates and times. In this case, use the {@link sap.m.DatePicker}, {@link sap.m.DateRangeSelection}, {@link sap.m.TimePicker}, or {@link sap.m.DateTimePicker} instead.
Note: The control uses a JavaScript number to keep its value, which has a certain precision limitation. In general, exponential notation is used:
  • if there are more than 21 digits before the decimal point.
  • if number starts with "0." followed by more than five zeros.
Exponential notation is not supported by the control and using it may lead to unpredictable behavior. Also, the JavaScript number persists its precision up to 16 digits. If the user enters a number with a greater precision, the value will be rounded. This limitation comes from JavaScript itself and it cannot be worked around in a feasible way.

getLargerStep.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getLargerStep largerStep}. Increases/decreases the value with a larger value than the set step only when using the PageUp/PageDown keys. Default value is 2 times larger than the set step. Default value is 2.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.StepInput.

setStepMode.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getStepMode stepMode}. Defines the calculation mode for the provided step and largerStep. If the user increases/decreases the value by largerStep, this calculation will consider it as well. For example, if the current value is 3, step is 5, largerStep is 5 and the user chooses PageUp, the calculation logic will consider the value of 3x5=15 to decide what will be the next value. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is AdditionAndSubtraction.

parameters.sStepMode: type: sap.m.StepInputStepModeType, description: New value for property stepMode

setValueState.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getValueState valueState}. Accepts the core enumeration ValueState.type that supports None, Error, Warning and Success. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is None.

parameters.sValueState: type: sap.ui.core.ValueState, description: New value for property valueState

parameters.sTextAlign: type: sap.ui.core.TextAlign, description: New value for property textAlign

Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:change change} event of this sap.m.StepInput. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.StepInput itself. Is fired when one of the following happens:
  1. the text in the input has changed and the focus leaves the input field or the enter key is pressed.
  2. One of the decrement or increment buttons is pressed

sap.m.StepInput.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new StepInput. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getMin min} : float
    • {@link #getMax max} : float
    • {@link #getStep step} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getStepMode stepMode} : sap.m.StepInputStepModeType (default: AdditionAndSubtraction)
    • {@link #getLargerStep largerStep} : float (default: 2)
    • {@link #getValue value} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder} : string
    • {@link #getRequired required} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getValueStateText valueStateText} : string
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDisplayValuePrecision displayValuePrecision} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getDescription description} : string
    • {@link #getFieldWidth fieldWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 50%)
    • {@link #getTextAlign textAlign} : sap.ui.core.TextAlign (default: End)
    • {@link #getValidationMode validationMode} : sap.m.StepInputValidationMode (default: FocusOut)
  • Aggregations
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

The value should be between 0 (default) and 20. In case the value is not valid it will be set to the default value. Default value is 0.

getStepMode.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getStepMode stepMode}. Defines the calculation mode for the provided step and largerStep. If the user increases/decreases the value by largerStep, this calculation will consider it as well. For example, if the current value is 3, step is 5, largerStep is 5 and the user chooses PageUp, the calculation logic will consider the value of 3x5=15 to decide what will be the next value. Default value is AdditionAndSubtraction.

setLargerStep.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getLargerStep largerStep}. Increases/decreases the value with a larger value than the set step only when using the PageUp/PageDown keys. Default value is 2 times larger than the set step. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 2.

parameters.fLargerStep: type: float, description: New value for property largerStep

getRequired.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getRequired required}. Indicates that user input is required. This property is only needed for accessibility purposes when a single relationship between the field and a label (see aggregation labelFor of sap.m.Label) cannot be established (e.g. one label should label multiple fields). Default value is false.

Constructor for a new LightBox. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.m.LightBox.!description:
Represents a popup containing an image and a footer.

Overview

The purpose of the control is to display an image in its original size as long as this is possible. On smaller screens images are scaled down to fit. Notes:
  • If the image doesn't load in 10 seconds, an error is displayed.
  • Setting the imageContent aggregation of the control as well as the source of the image and the title of the image is mandatory. If the image source is not set, the control will not open.

Structure

Each LightBox holds a {@link sap.m.LightBoxItem LightBoxItem} which keeps the properties of the image:
  • imageSrc - The source URI of the image
  • title - The title of the image
  • subtitle - The subtitle of the image
  • alt - The alt text of the image

Usage

The most common use case is to click on an image thumbnail to view it in bigger size. When the image that should be displayed in the control cannot be loaded, an error is displayed in the popup.

Responsive Behavior

On a mobile device, flipping the device to landscape will flip the lightbox and the image will be adjusted to fit the new dimensions.

Additional Information

Check out the API Reference.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.LightBox.

parameters.oImageContent: type: sap.m.LightBoxItem, description: The imageContent whose index is looked for

parameters.oOrigin: type: object, description: Origin of the invalidation.

Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getImageContent imageContent}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.
